Install the dslabs package if you haven’t already (install.packages("dslabs"). Create a rfalling_object using the code below (note, the set.seed() is crucial otherwise the random number generator won’t be the same. Use the value 49 for my_number)

library(tidyverse)
library(dslabs)

set.seed(my_number)
falling <- rfalling_object(n = 1000)

Create a new column using mutate() of the absolute value difference between the distance and observed_distance columns (the R function abs() will be useful). What is te sum of the values in this column? Give your answer to the nearest whole number.
